description:
Functions to convert from and to `duckdb_[date, time, time_tz, timestamp]`.
// `duckdb_is_finite_timestamp[_s, _ms, _ns]` helper functions.

comment.description: Decompose a `duckdb_date` object into year, month and date (stored as `duckdb_date_struct`).

param_comments.date: The date object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_DATE` column.

comment.description: Re-compose a `duckdb_date` from year, month and date (`duckdb_date_struct`).

param_comments.date: The year, month and date stored in a `duckdb_date_struct`.

comment.description: Test a `duckdb_date` to see if it is a finite value.

param_comments.date: The date object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_DATE` column.

comment.return_value: True if the date is finite, false if it is ±infinity.

comment.description: Decompose a `duckdb_time` object into hour, minute, second and microsecond (stored as `duckdb_time_struct`).

param_comments.time: The time object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_TIME` column.

comment.description: Create a `duckdb_time_tz` object from micros and a timezone offset.

param_comments.micros: The microsecond component of the time.
param_comments.offset: The timezone offset component of the time.

comment.description:
Decompose a TIME_TZ objects into micros and a timezone offset.

Use `duckdb_from_time` to further decompose the micros into hour, minute, second and microsecond.

param_comments.micros: The time object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_TIME_TZ` column.

comment.description: Re-compose a `duckdb_time` from hour, minute, second and microsecond (`duckdb_time_struct`).

param_comments.time: The hour, minute, second and microsecond in a `duckdb_time_struct`.

param_comments.ts: The ts object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP` column.

comment.description: Test a `duckdb_timestamp` to see if it is a finite value.

param_comments.ts: The duckdb_timestamp object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP` column.

comment.return_value: True if the timestamp is finite, false if it is ±infinity.

comment.description: Test a `duckdb_timestamp_s` to see if it is a finite value.

param_comments.ts: The duckdb_timestamp_s object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP_S` column.

comment.return_value: True if the timestamp is finite, false if it is ±infinity.

comment.description: Test a `duckdb_timestamp_ms` to see if it is a finite value.

param_comments.ts: The duckdb_timestamp_ms object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP_MS` column.

comment.return_value: True if the timestamp is finite, false if it is ±infinity.

comment.description: Test a `duckdb_timestamp_ns` to see if it is a finite value.

param_comments.ts: The duckdb_timestamp_ns object, as obtained from a `DUCKDB_TYPE_TIMESTAMP_NS` column.

comment.return_value: True if the timestamp is finite, false if it is ±infinity.
